citation.article-title: Methanocorpusculaceae fam. nov., represented by Methanocorpusculum parvum, Methanocorpusculum sinense spec. nov. and Methanocorpusculum bavaricum spec. nov.

p.s: Methanocorpuseulaceae (Me.tha.no.cor.pus.cu.la.ce'ae M.L.neut.n.; Methanocorpusculum type genus of the family. -aceae, ending to denote a family; M.L. fem. pl. n. Methanocorpusculaceae, the Methanocorpusculum family)
At present the family Methanocorpusculaceae contains one genus, Methanocorpusculum.
Small irregular eoccoid cells, usually singly, weakly motile or non-motile, staining Gram-negative.
The cell envelope consists of a hexagonally arranged S-layer, containing a glycoprotein of Mr around 90000 kD.
Growth on and methane production from H2/CO2, formate, 2-propanol/CO2 and/or 2-butanol/CO2.
No salt requirement, but may tolerate salt.
Growth factors present in rumen fluid may stimulate growth.
Tungstate may promote growth. 1,3- Diaminopropane is a major polyamine.
The G + C content of DNA ranges from 47.7 to 52.0 mol% (Tm).
Strains inhabit anaerobic niches, e.g. sediments, bioreactors etc., in different parts of the world.
